title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NTNU
Interview Descriptions: It was a pleasant process with no difficult or tricky questions. There was the supervisor and another professor of the department. I also was asked for a short presentation of my work/thesis.
Interview Questions: Why do you apply to NTNU?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NTNU
Interview Descriptions: It was a very professional interview. Most of the questions were related to my previous relevant experiences. The answers were encouraged. I was given enough time and comfort to answer the questions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Short Introduction about respective department by Interviewer, Introduction and presentation about candidate academic background and accomplishments. Few technical questions by interviewer. Chance to ask questions from your side. Closing statement by interviewer. Done.
Interview Questions: What atmosphere do you expect as a phd candidate from us?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NTNU
Interview Descriptions: I had inteview with two Professors. The interview process was easy and direct to the requirements and specifications of the position. No personality or IQ tests.  It took about one hour.
Interview Questions: Very general questions about your study background

title: PhD Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NTNU
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of interviews  in which my technical knowledge was tested as well as my suitablity to living in Norway. I was interviewed by 4 mebers of staff, 3 being academic and 1 coming from the HR department.
Interview Questions: Was asked technical questions regarding to my understanding of the science layed out in the job description.

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The first step is the evaluation of Diploma supplement, CV, and cover letter. Then, a shortlist is published and you are asked to write a research proposal (based on the PhD topic and some relevant journal papers). Finally, there is an interview, fairly relaxed and informal. The professors of the committee are very kind and patient.
Interview Questions: Why Norway and why NTNU?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NTNU
Interview Descriptions: two rounds of interview.  First interview is general and easy. Second interview is more specific. Two people from the faculty and one from HR department sit there. They asked for a paper review which I did. They give you feedback on it. They also asked for a research proposal but if your profile is relevant they still interview you if you did not include the proposal.
Interview Questions:
Why do you apply for this position?
What are your programming skills?
What are your weaknesses?
Do you like team work or individual?

title: Janitor/Cleaner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: We had a meeting in person where they asked about my experience as a janitor. Asked me to tell them a little bit about myself. Standard interview questions, like strengths, weaknesses etc.
Interview Questions: What do you feel about routines?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Apply via mail and then they select candidates based on grades from the course. Based on this they decide to give you a position or not.  There might be some startup meeting to tell you about the tasks then you can accept or not
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NTNU
Interview Descriptions: it is through skype with the professor and a post doctor. It takes about an hour and  the questions are quite detailed. A presentation of the previous work is required including publication and thesis.
Interview Questions: What is the topic of your previous master thesis

title: PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim)
Interview Descriptions: We first exchanged a few emails, then spoke to the professors supervising the position. The interview lasted about 45 minutes and a few weeks later I eventually got an email saying I got the position.
Interview Questions: A lot on my background and work ethic

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NTNU
Interview Descriptions:
Short list form the application.
Then formal interview and trial lecture with a scientific committee and students representative.
Discussion with other members of the research group
Final decision and negotiation of contract, with details of research funding and laboratories
Interview Questions: Typical questions you can find also online: Motivation, Contribution, Challenges, Strengthen and Weakness, future plans...

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied this position on December, 2018, interviewed over Skype on February, 2019. Notified as the second in a waiting list on April. Notified the selected candidate accepted the offer on May.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with cutting-edge VR technology, such as HTC Vive or Oculus?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at NTNU (Gjøvik) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was rather informal as I did my master in NTNU.  They did ask about my masters degree and whether I have the passion and motivation to start PhD journey
Interview Questions: What is my average grade for master and my grade for my thesis?

title: PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at NTNU (Gjøvik) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through jobbnorge.no, received interview e-mail after 2 months. After interview they asked me to provide IELTS score. So i started preparing for test and appeared after 15 days of my interview. Fortunately i scored good in test and provided my IELTS scores. Finally, i got selection e-mail one and half month later and accepted that offer.
Interview Questions:
Q: Why Norway?
Q: Why PhD?
Q: Previous research experience?
Q: Biggest achievement of your life?
Q: How do you fit for this position?
Q: Your positives and negatives?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at NTNU
Interview Descriptions: Mostly ask the grades and some basic knowledge of the subject. They need to understand of you are able to guide the students. Be open, people in Norway are easy-going
Interview Questions: Which grade do you have in this course?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Found position posted online. Wrote application, motivation letter, CV and applied for the position. At the interview I was asked questions pertaining to my motivation for getting a PhD, my experience in previous research, work ethics and what I expected from my PI. No tasks or case based problems to solve.
Interview Questions: What are some skills you could improve by working for us?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds for the interview. Fellow from HR department with my two supervisors hold the interview. A very good conversation. The interviewers are very nice to talk and we have good communications on interested questions. The interviewers intended to test the Language level (if you are an international student); Professional level; Background; Motivation, etc.
Interview Questions: Q: What would be your advantage taking this position

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: We had multiple skype interviews before they invited me to Trondheim to see the place and have final interview there. I would say it was very pleasant and honest interview.
Interview Questions:
I was asked on my final interview to present my research work so far! 
Before that interview, I had standard interview questions (about motivation, and some about the field I was applying for (MRI) and do I feel comfortable with it)

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Only depending on your grades. The process is quite easy, but of course you need good grades to get the job. They also ask if you are serious and can commit to meet the students every week and prepare for the sessions. But this is more a check as people tend to say yes
Interview Questions: What is your grades

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone call first and a face-to-face interview later. The phone call was not easy due to the use of the hand-free set. I was a bit lost due to I do not know the details about the project I was going to be involved in. They sent me something about it in advance, but it was not enough to understand the topic. Indeed, now I realize that they did not have defined the scope of the research yet.
Interview Questions: My previous research papers and experience.

title: Phd Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview. Fairly easy and relaxed. just technical and few personal questions were asked. There was a panel of the two supervisors, head of the department, faculty and department representatives. Immediately got the offer at the end of interview in an informal way.
Interview Questions: Why NTNU? Why PhD.....

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at NTNU (Oslo) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: questions about my background. i had to prepare a presentation and there were many questions following the presentations. Afterwards i have been asked also motivational questions about myself and my personality. Technical questions might be tough.
Interview Questions: technical questions regarding my background

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at NTNU (Trondheim) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was a master student and continued to the PhD and therefore the interview was not so difficult. Got questions about my past experience as well as my abilities to do independent research and writing.
Interview Questions: Was no difficult queston
